title: That feeling when Kindred's buffs get reverted.
body:
Thanks Riot.

No, the buffs were not aimed towards the right spots in the first place.
Yes, they were still buffs that would have helped SOMEWHAT.

replies.body: No one wants to see this easy mode champion being viable. I understand why they reverted these buffs.

I think Kindred has existed in a state that they were relatively easy to succeed with. Mind you, never in my hands.  It took the type of aggression and mechanical play I lack.  But, quite a bit of power has been trimmed out, and Kindred doesn't just win every early duel anymore, which seems appropriate.

The Kindred on Live nowadays I think is quite the opposite of easy mode. They fulfill a role your team often doesn't want out of the jungle, requires you to hunt down marks and call out targets, and needs to survive a somewhat difficult early game.  

While we've been considering giving her slight buffs in the last couple of patches, we've opted to hold off because she is incredibly successful in the hands of an experienced player.  So much so that it would be near irresponsible to give her flat-out buffs, especially given that a lot of her most popular competition has been toned down recently.

That's literally the opposite of why they removed it. It was intended to help them clear the jungle but ended up providing too much duelling power.

Why not just let Kindred heal off of their marks only? That way, they don't always have full health in the jungle and won't have insane dueling power, it WILL make their mark-invades safer, making them less team-reliant. It also puts more pressure on marking the correct target because the player will have to take the heal they _could_ get into consideration when invading and ganking.

I definitely think a buff to their early game stats wouldn't be uncalled for, or perhaps something as simple as preventing it from marking inside the enemy jungle as the first mark. For me, games where the scuttlecrab is marked first end up a lot better than ones where raptors are the first mark.

Not gonna lie, Seasons 2-4 I bluntly labelled Marksmen played outside of Bot Lane as "a gimmick" and something that should be easily punishable by the opposition. Since mid-season 5, Riot has done the opposite of what I thought they'd ever do and promote what I deem to be unhealthy gameplay by designing Marksmen to be played Top and Jungle. I think it's something Riot needs to actively work toward removing from the game. Graves Top and Jungle is incredibly unhealthy for the game, as was Nidalee and Kindred jungle & Quinn Top and Jungle before Riot realised how unhealthy their play patters were and deliberately gimped them so that they'd disappear from competitive.

6-7 Preseason needs to address non-Bot Lane Marksmen and either turn them into mid lane AD Casters (a la Jayce) or ADC-Support Bot Lane Marksmen.
